task.name: feather
task.shortdescription: Combine two images using their Fourier transforms
task.description:
This task can be used as one method of combining single-dish and interferometric images after they have been separately made.
The algorithm converts each image to the gridded visibility plane, combines them, and reconverts them into an combined image. Each image must include a well-defined beam shape (clean beam) in order for feathering to work well. The two images must have the same flux density normalization scale.

param.name: imagename
param.description:
Name of output feathered image Default: none
Example: imagename='orion_combined.im'

param.name: highres
param.description:
Name of high resolution (interferometer) image Default: none
Example: imagename='orion_vla.im'

param.name: lowres
param.shortdescription: Name of low resolution (single dish) image
param.description:
Name of low resolution (single dish) image Default: none
Example: imagename='orion_gbt.im'

param.name: sdfactor
param.shortdescription: Scale factor to apply to Single Dish image
param.description:
Value by which to scale the Single Dish image. Default: 1.0
Basically modifying the flux scale of the SD image

param.name: effdishdiam
param.shortdescription: New effective SingleDish diameter to use in m
param.description:
New effective SingleDish diameter to use in m Default: -1.0 (leave as is)
Obviously one can only reduce the dish effective dish diameter in feathering.

param.name: lowpassfiltersd
param.shortdescription: Filter out the high spatial frequencies of the SD image
param.description:
Filter out the high spatial frequencies of the SD image Default: False
If True the high spatial frequency in the SD image is rejected.
Any data outside the maximum uv distance that the SD has illuminated is filtered out.
